channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Biden says Supreme Court's immunity ruling 'undermines the rule of law'
item.description: President Biden said the court's decision puts "virtually no limits on what a president can do" and used it to argue against former President Donald Trump's reelection bid.
item.content:encoded:
President Biden said the court's decision puts "virtually no limits on what a president can do" and used it to argue against former President Donald Trump's reelection bid.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: The idea of manhood looms large in the current GOP
item.description: In the era of Donald Trump, Republicans have made manhood increasingly central to how they campaign.
item.content:encoded: In the era of Donald Trump, Republicans have made manhood increasingly central to how they campaign.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: Requests for sterilization after 'Dobbs' decision wasn't just a temporary trend
item.description: New research indicates the uptick in requests for sterilization following the Dobbs decision on abortion was not a temporary trend. Nationally, numbers of tubal ligations and vasectomies are up.
item.content:encoded: New research indicates the uptick in requests for sterilization following the Dobbs decision on abortion was not a temporary trend. Nationally, numbers of tubal ligations and vasectomies are up.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Bolton

item.title: Anger over the Gaza war fuels independent candidates in U.K. election
item.description: Anger over Gaza is fueling support for independent candidates in the July 4 UK election. One poll shows British Muslim support for the UK Labour Party has halved since 2019.
item.content:encoded: Anger over Gaza is fueling support for independent candidates in the July 4 UK election. One poll shows British Muslim support for the UK Labour Party has halved since 2019.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: What to watch for in tonight's Copa America 2024 men’s soccer game
item.description: NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with ESPN soccer writer Luis Miguel Echegaray about the Copa America tournament and the U.S. men's team performances.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with ESPN soccer writer Luis Miguel Echegaray about the Copa America tournament and the U.S. men's team performances.
item.dc:creator: Gus Contreras

item.title: A federal judge's ruling could put noncompete ban on hold
item.description: A federal judge is expected to rule soon on whether to allow the Federal Trade Commission's ban on noncompete clauses to take effect in September. The decision could affect some 30 million people.
item.content:encoded: A federal judge is expected to rule soon on whether to allow the Federal Trade Commission's ban on noncompete clauses to take effect in September. The decision could affect some 30 million people.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: Meet the U.S. gymnastics and track and field athletes going to the Olympics
item.description: Over the weekend, the gymnastics and track and field athletes who will represent the United States at this month's Paris Olympics were finalized. They include a few surprises.
item.content:encoded: Over the weekend, the gymnastics and track and field athletes who will represent the United States at this month's Paris Olympics were finalized. They include a few surprises.
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: How to get better sleep
item.description: Feeling groggy these days? NPR's Life Kit has science-based strategies to help you sleep better, deeper and longer.
item.content:encoded: Feeling groggy these days? NPR's Life Kit has science-based strategies to help you sleep better, deeper and longer.
item.dc:creator: Clare Schneider

item.title: Legal expert reacts to today’s Supreme Court ruling on presidential immunity
item.description: Constitutional law expert Kim Wehle discusses what the Supreme Court's immunity decision means for former President Donald Trump's legal cases.
item.content:encoded: Constitutional law expert Kim Wehle discusses what the Supreme Court's immunity decision means for former President Donald Trump's legal cases.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Bartlam

item.title: A Georgia school trains doulas for rural areas that are losing maternity care
item.description: In Georgia, the Morehouse School of Medicine is training rural community doulas who will help pregnant women in the southwest part of the state, where maternal mortality rates are high.
item.content:encoded: In Georgia, the Morehouse School of Medicine is training rural community doulas who will help pregnant women in the southwest part of the state, where maternal mortality rates are high.
item.dc:creator: Jess Mador
